questions.question_text:
Given an HttpServletRequest request and an EJB SessionContext ctx.
Which is a valid way to retrieve the Principal invoking either behavior?

discussion.content: D is the correct syntax and awnser

questions.question_text: How can a servlet indicate to the browser that cookie data should be sent over a secure connection?

discussion.content: Option A but setSecure(true) not getSecure()

choices.C: Set the ENCRYPT header in the response.
choices.B: Encrypt the cookie data. The browser automatically sends encrypted data over a secure connection.
choices.A: Call the getSecure(true) method on the cookie object.
choices.D: Configure SessionTrackingMode.SSL on the ServletContext object.

questions.question_text: Which two features are provided by the JSTL Core library for a JSP? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Answer A, C. Can iterate through collection, Output values, Test Conditions ..........
A and C are correct answers

questions.question_text: Which of these can be a JPA entity?

discussion.content:
Correct is B.
- Must have @Entity.
- Must have public or protected no-arg constructor.
- Must be a top-level class but can be a concrete or an abstract class.
- Must not be final, Interface or Enum.

questions.question_text:
You created two filters for your web application by using the @WebFilter annotation, one for authorization and the other for narrowing results by the provided search criteria. The authorization filter must be invoked first.
How can you specify this?

discussion.content:
Answer B.
You can only define the order of filters in the chain using web.xml file.

choices.B: placing the filter mapping elements in the required order in the web.xml deployment descriptor
choices.D: specifying the filter precedence order by using the @Priority annotation
choices.C: placing @WebFilterMapping annotations in the required order
choices.A: setting the priority attribute of the @WebFilter annotation for each of the filters
